give out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to give something to each person in a group
give out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Can you give the drinks out, please?
Students were giving out leaflets to everyone on the street.
give out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if part of your body gives out, it stops working properly or becomes much weaker
give out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Just as I approached the town, my legs finally gave out.
give out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if a supply of something gives out, there is none left
give out.translation[0].definitions[2].e: My money was beginning to give out and there were no jobs to be found.
After two hours her patience gave out.
give out.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to produce something such as light, heat, or a signal
give out.translation[0].definitions[3].e: A gas lamp gave out a pale yellowish light.
give out.translation[0].definitions[4].e: It was given out that the government was to enter into negotiations with the rebels.
